metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20020 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
LibVNC before commit 7b1ef0ffc4815cab9a96c7278394152bdc89dc4d contains heapout-of-bound write vulnerability inside structure in VNC client code thatcan result remote code execution

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20020` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.3
libvncserver-config - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.3
libvncserver1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

italc-client - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

ssvnc - 1.9.29-2+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.3').
italc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1').
ssvnc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.29-2+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
tightvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
